South Korean Farmers against Negotiation on Rice Market Opening 
    Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Farmers belonging to the Federation of Peasants Associations of south Korea staged a surprise protest on December 28 last year in front of the "government" building against the authorities' negotiation on opening the rice market, according to south Korean KBS.
 They attempted to break into the building in protest against the negotiation.    
 When the police blocked their way, they called a press conference and declared they would expand the fight against the negotiation.
